meanings.definition: To dig a hole or tunnel into the ground.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was burrowing into the soft earth to make a cozy home.
meanings.sent2: The mole is burrowing underground to find food.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried burrowing into the pillow to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree were burrowing deep into the soil for nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The miner's pickaxe was burrowing through the rock with determination.

meanings.definition: To search or rummage through something.
meanings.sent1: The detective was burrowing through the files to find the missing clue.
meanings.sent2: The child was burrowing in the toy box looking for his favorite car.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon was burrowing through the trash for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The student was burrowing through the library books to finish the research paper.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist was burrowing through the ancient ruins in search of artifacts.

meanings.definition: To move or press through or into something.
meanings.sent1: The snake was burrowing through the tall grass to reach its burrow.
meanings.sent2: The crowd was burrowing through the narrow alley to get to the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat was burrowing through the curtains to peek outside.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was burrowing through the defense to score a goal.
meanings.sent5: The car was burrowing through the traffic to reach the destination on time.
